summary: This document is a cover letter from attorney George B. Donnini of Butzel Long to an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York, transmitting Interlochen Center for the Arts' confidential document production in response to two grand jury subpoenas dated February 6 and 10, 2020. It includes executed custodian certifications and requests confidentiality under FOIA.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.role: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney from Butzel Long who authored the cover letter submitting Interlochen's document production in response to grand jury subpoenas.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: A grand jury subpoena duces tecum was issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts, requesting specified records.

events.title: Second Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Interlochen
events.description: A second grand jury subpoena duces tecum was issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts, requesting additional specified records.

events.title: Document Production Submitted
events.description: Interlochen Center for the Arts, through its attorney, submitted a confidential document production on an encrypted flash drive in response to the two subpoenas.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Interlochen Center for the Arts was served with two federal grand jury subpoenas in February 2020 as part of an investigation.
The organization, represented by attorney George B. Donnini, produced hundreds of documents (INT000001 - INT000631) in response.
The document production was submitted confidentially with requests for FOIA exemption and protection of privileged materials.
The Assistant United States Attorney's name is redacted in the custodian declarations, indicating the ongoing sensitivity of the investigation.
The response indicates Interlochen's cooperation with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
